intro: Dorstenia barteri var. paucinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined dwarf arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and unique, spiral-shaped inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in dense, spiral arrangements. It is typically grown as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and compact growth habit. Dorstenia barteri var. paucinervis prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it suitable for indoor cultivation.
